meanings.definition: Capable of being carried or transported.
meanings.sent1: The small backpack was very totable for the young hiker.
meanings.sent2: The grocery bags were totable, making it easy for her to bring them home.
meanings.sent3: The totable suitcase looked like it was ready for a little adventure of its own.
meanings.sent4: Her totable determination to finish the race surprised everyone.
meanings.sent5: The totable box of memories weighed heavy on her heart.

meanings.definition: Suitable for being placed on a table.
meanings.sent1: The totable vase added a nice touch to the dining room decor.
meanings.sent2: The totable tray held all the snacks perfectly during the party.
meanings.sent3: The totable lamp seemed to brighten up the room with its presence.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as totable as the flowers on the table.
meanings.sent5: The totable book was a great addition to the coffee table.

meanings.definition: Able to be calculated or added up.
meanings.sent1: The totable expenses for the month were higher than expected.
meanings.sent2: The totable numbers on the spreadsheet made sense after careful review.
meanings.sent3: His totable score in the game was surprisingly low for a seasoned player.
meanings.sent4: The totable value of her collection was priceless to her.
meanings.sent5: The totable sum of their efforts resulted in a successful project completion.
